intro: Gochnatia lojaensis, commonly known as the Loja gochnatia, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and clustered in spherical inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gochnatia lojaensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
